item.description:
Sunim’s (Venerable’s) talk "Meditation of Self in Zen Therapy will address how Zen therapy helps notice our suffering and become aware of suffering's root causes so we can free ourselves from our obstacles.                     

Every 2nd and 4th Friday evening is Dinner With Dharma at the Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center at 950 Massachusetts Avenue, between Central and Harvard Squares, Cambridge.

6:30 p.m. Meditation (mostly just sitting quietly and calmly, breathing all the time, building up an appetite; it is led by a Buddhist nun or a leader in training)
7:00 p.m. Dinner (vegan- but ALWAYS ask because it reminds them)
7:30 p.m. Dharma Talk and Discussion (could go on for 2 hours or more, but it's supposed to be 90 minutes)

Special presentation by Korean nun, writer, and psychologist Seogwangsnim, Abbess of Sounsa Buddhist Temple in Paxton, MA, who is also an adjunct professor of at Dongguk University in Seoul, Korea teaching Buddhist Psychology and Zen Psychotherapy.

The title of Sunim’s (Venerable’s) talk is Meditation of Self in Zen Therapy.  She will be addressing how Zen therapy aims to help us first to notice our suffering and then become aware of the root causing this suffering so that we can free ourselves from our obstacles.

Peter Martin, the husband of Marjorie Jacobs, will be organizing the GBBCC kitchen while the 2 cooks (a husband-wife team who speak NO English) travel to Taiwan to experience the celebration of the Enlightenment of the Buddha; now that is REALLY "hard core" Buddhist).

Cost (Include vegan buffet dinner)
Adult: $10 Student: $5 (student ID required for the $5 half price)

7:45 p.m. Dharma Talk and Discussion (scheduled to finish around 9:00 pm)

PLEASE BRING CASH ONLY. GBBCC is unable to honor your Credit Cards!!!

Program organized by Ven. Man Kuang and Marjorie Jacobs.
They will provide Buddhist (a) perspectives affirming the importance of cultivating and (b) insights relating to issues in modern living.

Take the T to Central Square, http://www.mbta.com....
Walk in TOWARDS Harvard Square until you see 950 Mass Ave on the left (south) side of the street.

Please invite friends and family. If you have any questions, please call the GBBCC.
